item.title: Archibald Prize: 100 years of Australia's top portrait honour
item.description: Over 100 years, the Archibald Prize has become better at reflecting Australian diversity.

item.title: Afghanistan: Record civilian casualties in 2021, UN reports
item.description: More than 1,600 civilians have been killed so far in 2021, and the UN fears a further rise.

item.title: US accused of demonising China in high-level talks
item.description: US Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman is the most senior official to visit under Mr Biden.

item.title: Sandstorm swallows city in northwestern China
item.description: Dust clouds towered at least 100 metres (330ft) over Dunhuang.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Momiji Nishiya wins skateboarding gold at just 13
item.description: At the age of 13, Japan's Momiji Nishiya wins the first-ever Olympic gold medal in women's street skateboarding.

item.title: Dieter Brummer: Home and Away actor dies aged 45
item.description: Brummer famously played Shane Parrish - Melissa George's love interest on the TV soap in the 1990s.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: S Korea TV sorry for using pizza to depict Italy
item.description: MBC also used Chernobyl to depict Ukraine and Dracula to show Romania at the Olympics opening ceremony.

item.title: Maharashtra: How one city avoided worst of India floods
item.description: At least 149 people have died across the Indian state this monsoon season.

item.title: Shares in Chinese online tutoring firms slump after shake-up
item.description: It is one of the biggest ever overhauls of China's $120bn private tutoring industry.

item.title: Tencent shares slide after Beijing crackdown on music rights
item.description: China's market watchdog said the technology giant broke the country's anti-competition rules.

item.title: India landslide: Nine tourists killed as boulders fall from hilltop
item.description: A vehicle carrying tourists from Delhi is struck by large rocks in the state of Himachal Pradesh.

item.title: India monsoon: Rescuers search for survivors after heavy rains
item.description: Heavy rains have battered India's western coast, leaving dozens dead and prompting mass evacuations.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: One athlete braved sharks and crocodiles
item.description: Training for the Olympics can be a full-time job but Jo Brigden-Jones has combined it with much more.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Travelling to an Olympic Games like no other
item.description: The BBC's Mariko Oi reflects on her personal experience of covering the Games during a global pandemic.

item.title: Why is the Great Barrier Reef in trouble? A simple guide
item.description: Australia's natural wonder faces a battle to survive - here's a simple guide.

item.title: Coronavirus: Was US money used to fund risky research in China?
item.description: What's the row about virus research in China between a prominent Republican and Dr Anthony Fauci?

item.title: Olympic Games Tokyo 2020: India's top medal contenders
item.description: India sends its largest ever contingent to the Tokyo Olympics in the hope of bettering its medals tally.

item.title: The battle for Indonesia's Gold Island
item.description: There are fears that a mine will threaten Sangihe island's ancient forests and local water supply.
